title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
Hi there!

Have 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works. Was pretty corroded in some places. thought i'd try my luck with the ultra sonic but same issue
So must be a sensor as I understand it?

thanks!

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message: I should mention, before it died the customer told me that it would only work with power supply plugged in. Would cut out as soon as it's disconnected.

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
Post U7100 voltage, pins 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 15, 26; only charger connected and also charger + battery.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 (ohm mode).

Also post PPBUS_G3H and 3V42 voltage on battery only.

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
Charger only:

pin 2 = 20v
pin 3 = 5.3v
pin 9 = 0.03
pin 12 = 3.4
pin 13 = 3.3
pin 15 = 0.06
pin 26 = 19.26v

Same result with battery and charger connected

Pin 17/18 3.3 ohms
pins 27/28 20 ohms  (seems high?)

3v42 is 3.4v on battery
PPBUS_G3H 7.3v on battery

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
Are you using original Apple Magsafe 2 charger?
Input voltage is too high even for 85W charger.
Try a known good one, 60W if possible.

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message: Whoops, i was using DCPS. i have a habbit of using this. I'll remeasure it now with the original charger

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message: same results with battery + charger

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
Start checking AVREF_SMC.
Also check all sensors output form page 42.

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
AVREF_SMC is good at 3.3

Nothing at PBUS_S0_VSENSE because there's no SMC_sensor_PWR_EN

DCIN_S5_VSENSE is 2.8V

SMC_CPU_VSENSE 0V

SMC_P1V05S0_VSENSE 0V (I'm guessing all S0 are down for obvious reasons)

SMC_CPUDDR_ISENSE 0V

SMC_P3V3S5_ISENSE 0V




How would it be possible to check sensors that rely on S0 rails if the machine isn't turning on hmmmm

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message: I'm probably missing something really simple aren't I :confused:

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
SMC_DCIN_VSENSE is now OK.
Check SMC_DCIN_ISENSE and SMC_BMON_ISENSE.
No pulse at all at L7520 when SMC_ONOFF_L is triggered?

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
SMC_DCIN_ISENSE is 0.03v
SMC_BMON_ISENSE 0.06v

No pulse with L7520 when SMC_ONOFF_L is triggered

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message: I no pulse a good sign or bad sign?

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
It should pulse at least, when SMC_ONOFF_L is triggered.
Check first if PM_PWRBTN_L reacts.

"retesting with orignal chargere"
Original Magsafe 2???
You can use bench power supply, with Magsafe 2 cable only.
Never test with Magsafe 1-->2 adapter.

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
How do you know these things :eek: yes I'm using an adapter pahahah 

changing now and trying it again. I'll check for PM_PWRBTN_L

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!

it's working now

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message: HOW? I'm now getting 5V at L7520

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message: Do you know what happened? do you think this is permanent? or maybe is it just coming on temporary?

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
It works with original Magsafe 2 now?
Still not working with adapter?
That's no problem...

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
Just tested with magsafe 1 + adaptor, nothing, dead!
Magsafe 2 no issues! WHAT!!

However it cannot detect the battery unfortunately still hmmmm

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message: So with the battery, when the machine is on and I unplug the magsafe, the computer will go off like it's going into sleep or hibernation. Fans will keep spinning. I'm assuming that's because it cannot detect the charge in the battery. The battery symbol from the status bar is also completely gone, if I try and enable it, it'll disable itself immediately

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message: DO NOT use anything but 85 watt OEM Magsafe 2 chargers on 2015 machines anything else causes issues. What voltage do you currently have on PPBUS_G3H without the battery?

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
So no battery detected on System Report too?
Did you try known good battery?
Even old one (no hold charge), just for test.

Post exact voltage for PPBUS_G3H with charger and battery, both connected.
Check resistance to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus (diode mode); also check voltage there.

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
here's system report. 
PPbus is 7.3 battery only
8.2 battery + charger
8.2 charger only 
Sometimes it stays on for a few more seconds when i pull DC

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
SCL = 2.6v
SDA = 3.4v

diode mode both are 1.5 (red probe ground, black probe pin)

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message: also, checked a few batteries, known working, all the same

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message: 8.2 volts means the SMC isn't running, and your SCL line is low which is no good. Resistance to ground on the SCL data line? Next thing would be try new ISL then next is SMC on that line if no short.

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
"diode mode both are 1.5 (red probe ground, black probe pin)"
This is really strange.
Are you sure to check in diode mode, with red probe at ground???
You should get aprox 0.500...
SCL line is blocked; could fail SMC, or U7100.

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
Wait my bad, you're right. I had the probes the wrong way hahahaha 

So yes 0.500 on each pin

Is it time to replace ISL?

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
Do you get identical value on both lines?
Less than 1% difference allowed...

Check if both R5380/81 are good.
Then change ISL; but I expect SMC issue...

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
Both lines identical at 0.513

resisters both perfect. will Try Isl

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message: ISL6259 doesn't require firmware; you can use new even...

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
it's the SMC... crap!! just tested donor ISL with exact same issues!


what's the best way to get hold of SMC's? just donor boards?

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message: Order 00165 donor boards pull it reball it and put it on your board

title: 820-00165 green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
message:
Always pick SMC from donor board, same model...
The firmware is critical.
